revised_title: Observation of the Transit of Mercury Over the Sun's Disc at Louvain
tldr: Nathaniel Pigott observes the transit of Mercury over the Sun's disc in Louvain, Netherlands, in 1786, using a Gregorian reflector, a quadrant, and a clock. He compares his observations with the calculated times from the Connoissance des Temps and discusses the differences. Pigott also provides a detailed account of the observations, including the internal and external contacts of Mercury, and the duration of the total egress.
